responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Improper Input Validation of Uploaded Files
    analysis: |
      The application allows users to upload files without proper validation of the file type or content. An attacker could potentially upload malicious scripts or other files that could be executed on the server, leading to various attacks such as remote code execution or data theft.
    cwe: CWE-434
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - Upload/images/ougc_awards/index.html
    classification: very promising

  - headline: External Entity Reference Vulnerability
    analysis: |
      The HTML file in the codebase does not have any sanitization or prevention against External Entity Reference (XXE) attacks. An attacker could potentially create or modify an XML file that is parsed by the application, allowing them to read files on the server or conduct other malicious activities.
    cwe: CWE-611
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - Upload/images/ougc_awards/index.html
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Improper Input Validation of Uploaded Files
leads.analysis: The application allows users to upload files without proper validation of the file type or content. An attacker could potentially upload malicious scripts or other files that could be executed on the server, leading to various attacks such as remote code execution or data theft.

leads.headline: External Entity Reference Vulnerability
leads.analysis: The HTML file in the codebase does not have any sanitization or prevention against External Entity Reference (XXE) attacks. An attacker could potentially create or modify an XML file that is parsed by the application, allowing them to read files on the server or conduct other malicious activities.
